https://image.tmdb.org/t/p/w500/p2bHD1mvgljpHuLJnI5r6iydOHC.jpg Travel back to late 18th century Lowell, MA, now infamous for its textile mills and its "Lowell Girls," the poor, barely-educated waifs who helped turn those mills into sweatshops. David Macaulay: Mill Times
